{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3557828,"name":"","username":"TheBatman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thebatman/{size}/255139_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-15T20:53:59.489Z","cooked":"

Hello, our team uses for the current year a limelight 2+, it have been working as it should but we encountered a problem.
Due to the current position of the limelight it cannot see the reef april tags when we are aligned, so we believe that we might need to get another limelight.

Because we haven’t worked with multiple limelights yet we have some questions and worries and we would like your help, we are currently working with limelighthelpers -

  • how do we set up two limelights? from what i have read in other posts - we need to change some parts not according to the documentation.
  • Is there anything we should know about working with 2 limelights before we commit to it?
  • How do 2 limelight network tables work behind the scenes (we are asking this to know if there is we should look out for)?

The second thing is that the limelights will be positions in “weird” places, they will be off to the side of the robot and slanted down (and maybe slanted towards the middle), we are aware that you can set up in the website the limelight’s relative position so it will work with these positions in theory, but will it work only in theory or also in reality? and if not, what problems we might encounter?

I know i’m asking alot of questions but any clarification would help, thanks alot.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-03-15T20:53:59.489Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":13,"reads":183,"readers_count":182,"score":141.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":495705,"topic_slug":"two-limelights-in-weird-positions","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71857,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Vigilante"},"post_url":"/t/two-limelights-in-weird-positions/495705/1","custom_user_title":"Vigilante","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3557970,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-16T00:14:16.684Z","cooked":"

You give the two LL different names and IP addresses if you are static. Use those names in the LL helpers method calls.

We had two LL and one pose was a couple inches off of the other that was a better pose so we removed the bad LL.

I didnt quite understand the last part, so im still unsure whether placing the limelight in a weird place (inside the robot) will affect it’s accuracy.

Regarding setting up two limelights, in order to set up their names and IP addresses i will need to access the website of each respective limelight, how do i do that?

TheBatman:

I didnt quite understand the last part, so im still unsure whether placing the limelight in a weird place (inside the robot) will affect it’s accuracy.

The Limelight website explains how the camera should be positioned for the most accurate measurement. Probably they couldn’t find a suitable place, something blocking limelight or measured the config values incorrectly.

TheBatman:

Regarding setting up two limelights, in order to set up their names and IP addresses i will need to access the website of each respective limelight, how do i do that?

Use Limelight Hardware Manager

TheBatman:

Due to the current position of the limelight it cannot see the reef april tags when we are aligned, so we believe that we might need to get another limelight.

Even if it saw the limelight once apriltag on approach, the robot knows its position in the field correctly. You can quickly align by looking at your position in the field. If you are not aligning according to odometry, you can approach after measuring from a close distance that limelight will see. The first method is much more reliable.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-03-16T10:19:12.476Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":2,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":67,"readers_count":66,"score":28.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":495705,"topic_slug":"two-limelights-in-weird-positions","display_username":"Emre ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.limelightvision.io/docs/resources/downloads#limelight-hardware-manager","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Downloads | Limelight Documentation","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64968,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/two-limelights-in-weird-positions/495705/4","custom_user_title":"Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3558177,"name":"","username":"TheBatman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thebatman/{size}/255139_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-16T10:28:17.121Z","cooked":"
DukeEmree:

Use Limelight Hardware Manager

Thank you, i will research about that.

DukeEmree:

Even if it saw the limelight once apriltag on approach, the robot knows its position in the field correctly. You can quickly align by looking at your position in the field. If you are not aligning according to odometry, you can approach after measuring from a close distance that limelight will see. The first method is much more reliable.

Right not this is pretty much what we do, but we noticed that when we align towards l2-3 - the robot aligns it self to the wrong position, when we check the odometry it reports that the robot is at the correct position even though it isn’t there.
It doesn’t happen when we align towards l4, towards l4 we need to keep a distance from the reef (it still doesn’t see the april tag but the robot has less time without vision) and when we align to l4 the robot aligns to the correct position.
Due to the fact that towards l2-3 the robot aligns to the wrong position even though the odometry believes that it is in the correct position we believe that the problem is because the odometry itself struggles to get the correct position and if the limelight could see the april tag from closer it would solve the problem.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-03-16T10:28:17.121Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":53,"readers_count":52,"score":15.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":495705,"topic_slug":"two-limelights-in-weird-positions","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71857,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Vigilante"},"post_url":"/t/two-limelights-in-weird-positions/495705/5","custom_user_title":"Vigilante","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3558178,"name":"Emre ","username":"DukeEmree","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dukeemree/{size}/251833_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-16T10:36:20.533Z","cooked":"
TheBatman:

Due to the fact that towards l2-3 the robot aligns to the wrong position even though the odometry believes that it is in the correct position we believe that the problem is because the odometry itself struggles to get the correct position and if the limelight could see the april tag from closer it would solve the problem.

I didn’t expect your odometry to slip so easily. Usually it doesn’t slip this much (at least not with us). Maybe the wheels are drifting on the carpet or it can be swerve config issue.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-03-16T10:36:20.533Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":46,"readers_count":45,"score":14.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":495705,"topic_slug":"two-limelights-in-weird-positions","display_username":"Emre ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64968,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/two-limelights-in-weird-positions/495705/6","custom_user_title":"Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3558179,"name":"","username":"TheBatman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thebatman/{size}/255139_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-16T10:51:44.267Z","cooked":"

Its hard to tell, i will certainty look out for any misconfigurations or wheel drift.

I will note that our limelight is right in the most front-end of the robot, so it does lose sight quite early, as well as the mis-alignment happens almost only on the side reef walls.
On the reef walls that are parallel to the driver station it does once in a while not align perfectly but on the side reef walls it constantly misses, so maybe the direction of the travel makes the problem worse.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-03-16T10:51:44.267Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":41,"readers_count":40,"score":8.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":495705,"topic_slug":"two-limelights-in-weird-positions","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":64968,"username":"DukeEmree","name":"Emre ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dukeemree/{size}/251833_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71857,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Vigilante"},"post_url":"/t/two-limelights-in-weird-positions/495705/7","custom_user_title":"Vigilante","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3558182,"name":"John Hascall (he)","username":"john3928","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-16T11:15:02.768Z","cooked":"
TheBatman:

The second thing is that the limelights will be positions in “weird” places, they will be off to the side of the robot and slanted down (and maybe slanted towards the middle), we are aware that you can set up in the website the limelight’s relative position so it will work with these positions in theory, but will it work only in theory or also in reality?

Yes, your limelight’s do not need to be “square” with your robot. Neither of ours are centered and one is pointed slightly downwards and the other is pointed slightly rightwards.

BTW, I would recommend using CAD to determine your camera position & orientation over trial and error. Look up your camera’s horizontal and vertical Field Of View angles and draw a “pyramid” coming out of the lens using those values. All of an April tag will need to fall within the pyramid to be seen.

PS, do not make our mistake and assume your competition field(s) will be perfectly to spec – everything has a tolerance (eg +/- 0.5"). Leave yourself some “slop”. That is, design based on the tag(s) being in the worst possible location for your robot. For example if the reef tag is in the left side of your FOV, assume it was placed 1/2" left of center.
